intro: Actinotus paddisonii, commonly known as the Paddison's starflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant has a low-growing habit with succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
